website_summaries.verdict: Quality, heat-resistant gloves that are perfect if you're going to be working around hot steam or moisture.
pros: Waterproof neoprene coating with a cotton interior
Flexible enough to give you a full range of motion
cons: Dye used on outer coating may wash off when you clean the gloves

customer_reviews.title: COUNTERFEIT PRODUCT?!?
customer_reviews.text: Mine says counterfeit product?? What the heck?!? They have a real robust rubber/chemical smell to them. Is this right??
customer_reviews.author: Lc

customer_reviews.title: Tore after several uses. Does not work for prolonged contact at all.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these gloves for removing food pans from a full size warmer oven. It worked somewhat but definitely did not protect against prolonged contact. However since we were just using it for very short periods of time it did its job. The reason why I'm giving it one star is because parts of the glove have already melted and torn from perhaps 20 uses, and the gloves now garbage. The warmer oven reaches 275 degrees at most so we certainly did not use it in an environment that is too hot or beyond its stated capabilities. It is obviously a quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: syeb

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I really like the gloves. I bought them primarily for BBQ brisket and ribs - can handle cooked meat without disturbing the bark. I have some woven gloves that I've used for some time in the kitchen but their issue is that they can't handle steam or liquid. These gloves solve that problem. One thing I use the woven gloves for, and these gloves will work too though not as nimbly, is to search through frozen foods in a chest freezer. The only improvement I can think of would be to make the cuffs a bit longer, though this is really not an issue. [They make a longer glove (3 inches longer) if that is what you want] Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They serve their purpose
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars, easy. Won’t expect to pick up hot coals and hold them in your hands for more than a few seconds but they serve their purpose. I use them for picking up logs in the fire and as long as it’s less than 3 seconds, no problem. I also use them for the bbq, I wear them when I’m cleaning the grill with a piece of aluminum foil and can easily clean the grill for 15-20 seconds before I start to feel the heat. I will say that once I feel the heat, it takes a bit for these to cool off but that’s a small complaint, they serve their purpose well
customer_reviews.author: Blakay

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it’s the genuine product made in America not China.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these gloves from Amazon, represented to be Artisan Griller, but when received were made in China, no Artisan Griller label. Returned and ask for the genuine product from Artisan Griller and received made in China a second time. Returned these also and had to order directly from Artisan Griller for the correct gloves. My daughter who lives in Northern California ordered the exact same thing and got the genuine Artisan Griller gloves... Frustrating. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Bareader

customer_reviews.title: NO, REPEAT, NO PROTECTION ABOVE 200 DEG F!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great for washing dishes in hot water or for any of the other tasks described by the manufacturer except- handling BBQ grills. Do NOT, repeat do NOT, use these gloves to remove any item from a BBQ. I received some bad burns while attempting to pick up the grilling plate with cooked salmon on it. The gloves instantly passed the grills 450 degF heat. I will be returning these gloves to the the supplier for refund or appropriate replacement,.
customer_reviews.author: Edb4pax

customer_reviews.title: Failed at the only job it was supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Nope. Don't do it. Burned my husband's hand. Do yourself a favor and just buy some regular welding gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: these are horrible! They DO NOT protect against heat
customer_reviews.text: these are horrible! They DO NOT protect against heat. My husband was changing out the smoke box in the electric smoker and he had to drop it because the heat immediately came through. I tried using them to pull some pork and the heat came through as well. Not to mention, unless you are the hulk they are going to be huge on you. DO NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Txfirefly

customer_reviews.title: A bit thick but that is necessary
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace a similar pair that had come with my Ronco rotisserie. It works well for removing cooked chickens from the spit and other times I need to pick up something hot from the oven. Then I wash them while still on my hands by putting a bit of dish soap and washing my hands, then scrubbing anything stubborn with the dish brush, and rinsing. I usually stand them over a soap bottle or narrow glass until dry. They are thick and would not be suitable when you need more dexterity of fingers but are perfect for handling larger hot items from the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Hankin

customer_reviews.title: Getting this on and off is great, heat is undetectable, love them
customer_reviews.text: I have some old silicone gloves that work well but my dog thought they were too tasty to resist. I needed a new pair and this looked like they fit the bill. I'm a big guy and these fit nice and snug. The fingers are a little firm but not more than would be expected with a pair of gloves you might use to move charcoal or grab a steak with. They are easy to put on and take off which for me is a must. I would, and have, recommend these to a good friend or a neighbor. You won't regret getting a pair.
customer_reviews.author: AME Florida

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: I fell trap to what others had talked about in their reviews - rather than the legit, made-in-America gloves I got the Made in China knockoffs that are cheap and junky. I rolled the dice and lost. I'd be careful ordering these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: upsniles

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves!!!
customer_reviews.text: Of course, you can't hold a burning log, like some people would like. However, if you're looking at shifting a burning log, these will definitely help with that. I run a bbq business, and use these all the time. I shift lit wood around in the firebox of my smokers constantly, and have not had an issue with these gloves at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband. Literature for the product says they are having problems with counterfeit products. I received a counterfeit product. I purchased the 13” glove and the packaging says it’s 14.1”. Supposed to be made in the USA and they clearly say made in China. Supposed to have a card in the bag and there is no card. I called the company to tell them and left a message 4 days ago and still have yet to receive a call back.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.text: These BBQ gloves are going to hold up much better than the $15 pair that you will buy at your local store. They come up higher on your arms which keeps your arms from burning. The heat resistance is what you would expect (you will still be able to tell that there is heat but you won't burn). They are super easy to clean (it is just like washing your hands). The only downside is that you lose just a little dexterity but that is because they are a little thicker and more durable than the cheaper brands. These are totally worth the extra $10!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lee

customer_reviews.title: They do exactly what they say they do
customer_reviews.text: First off, these gloves are designed to handle cooked food. Holding a 500 Deg F pan in your hand will be a problem. Grabbing a 450 Deg F pan for a few seconds will work. Handling food up to 275 is where these shine. Most gloves are not rated fir food handling. These are and can be easily cleaned. They have no smell, no color bleed are roomy and work well. If you want to keep your hand in a high temp barbecue look elsewhere, if you want to grab a pan quickly or primarily if you want to handle food right off the barbecue then this is what you want. Work well and easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Luczak

customer_reviews.title: Mid-length sleeve oven mitts do the job!
customer_reviews.text: These came on time and were packaged well. They hold off the heat well enough but thickness (flex) vs. heat protection is always an issue. Gloves are a lot handier to use than mitts when grabbing open top cooking containers. These gloves are intended for the grill but I use them in the kitchen. The longer sleeve length is good when reaching deep into the hot oven but if working at the range or toaster oven they might be a little long. These, like all other gloves I tried, are not intended for pulling apart the hot grill pieces.
customer_reviews.author: dDave

customer_reviews.title: Ouch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use while processing my meat chickens, using them to submerge the bird in 155 degree water for approximately 15-20 seconds. I was unable to keep my hand submerged for the entire time as it became too uncomfortably hot. My friend had a different pair and they worked perfect. A little disappointed but I have other ideas for them so they will get a second chance at being useful.
customer_reviews.author: Willie Powell

customer_reviews.title: Finally found the PERFECT gloves to use when I bbq
customer_reviews.text: I own a Pit Barrel bbqer which is equipped with rods that get VERY hot. I also have to lift hooks out of the hot barrel that hang heavy meat. I purchased these gloves to use while bbqing with my Pit Barrel. These are FABULOUS! They withstand very high temperatures and I'm able to touch hot metal and move things on my bbqers without burning myself or my arms. They also come in handy when I need to move the hot cast iron griddles I use on my propane bbqer and my pellet grill. I'm a short woman with short arms and small hands. While these gloves are big, they don't feel big on me.
customer_reviews.author: DisneyMom

customer_reviews.title: Look somewhere else
customer_reviews.text: Fingers are too short. I use them a lot but I'm wouldn't recommend them to anyone. I wouldn't buy again. They keep the heat out nicely but I cant pickup just one wing off the smoker. Look around, there are some great gloves out there. I bought these on a "special" and regretted it
customer_reviews.author: Tac medic

customer_reviews.title: best bbq gloves I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are amazing. I used them for the first time to grab a 10 lb Top round out of my smoker and pull out the metal probe. The gloves worked fantastic they have superior grip on the meat and I didnt rub off my rub with the gloves nice to be able to just pull out my metal temp probe with the gloves no slipping. Im a large in gloves and thats what I ordered and they fit like a glove "no pun intended " easy registration process you text them give your email and they give you a 3 year warranty and they are made in the USA. I like that alot.. i give them a 10
customer_reviews.author: Good&Plenty

customer_reviews.title: Not heat resistant.
customer_reviews.text: May be fire resistant but not heat resistant. Was getting pain and mild burns when handling 350 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Greggo

customer_reviews.title: Not as soft and flexible as the description leads one to believe
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have almost up to the elbow sleeves which give more protection than most others, but they feel stiff and clumsy to me. I'm not able to handle the tongs and spatulas with the finesse that I'm accustomed to. I also expected a little more of a heat shielding fabric lining inside the gloves and a little less thick neoprene outer coating. I like that they clean up easily, but feel that the best of both worlds (more flexibility and more heat resistance) could have been achieved with a more substantial cotton fabric lining and a thinner neoprene coating.
customer_reviews.author: mr.consumr

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an EXCELLENT pit glove!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are simply the best gloves I've found for the task. I can easily grab a hot brisket, chicken, pork loin, etc. from the smoker with these. The texturing really helps! Easy to put on and take off with the lining too. I was concerned as I typically where XL to XXL gloves (depending on style), and these do fit me snug but I have no problem gripping with them and, as I indicated, the lining makes them easy on and off. I'm buying a second pair!
customer_reviews.author: RSV

customer_reviews.title: Fire proof! :)
customer_reviews.text: I got these for camping, so I could move logs, foil packs and grills around in the fire. I can reach down and pick up a flaming log with these things, no problem. You can't keep them on for long after that though, as the heat will continue to transfer and your hands will get hot after a while. Just I just put them on before I need to move something, then take them off. These will go with me on any future camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Murray

customer_reviews.title: So good that I had to buy another pair!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one set of pit of the shorter length pit gloves from Artisan Griller and finally found exactly what I needed - durable, good weight, non-slip, and could take the heat and handling a brisket, pork loin, etc. without feeling like I was destined for a juggling act! That set now stays with my portable smoker, and this new, longer set is for home. Couldn't be happier with both pairs!
customer_reviews.author: RSV

customer_reviews.title: We bought them for use with a barrel-style smoker and they do the job just fine. My only quibble is that I'm a woman ...
customer_reviews.text: I adore these! We bought them for use with a barrel-style smoker and they do the job just fine. My only quibble is that I'm a woman with small hands and these are huge on me to the point of causing dexterity loss. If they came in a smaller size, I would buy another pair in a heartbeat and use the gloves instead of standard cloth potholders in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Diotima

customer_reviews.title: heat will pass through
customer_reviews.text: this product will burn your hand when taking sheet pans out of a 350 oven ,I like that its a glove and it does go high enough on your arm to protect , but when pulling things out of the oven heat will pass through ,I would not buy this product again for what I need it for ,I like to add that they are durable ,so far,, but time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Patrick deblasio

customer_reviews.title: Chinese product.  I will return
customer_reviews.text: It says right on the bag Chinese made. I'll be returning these alao. If I was Artisan Griller I wouldn't sell to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite go to item. Often I will purchase something and was glad I did but if it ever broke I may never do it again. These however I would do in a heart beat. They work very well when I shred the super hot pulled pork right out of my smoker. I will often do a case at a time so they hold up the whole time too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for smokers
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that i was skeptical when i first received these. They seemed too thin to actually offer any protection. I am thrilled to be wrong. I use them with my kamado grill and can lift the grates and move some coals around when hot. They really shine when it comes to handling hot food. Just slip on the gloves and flip the food around with my hands instead of fumbling with tongs/spatulas. Great for removing large items like pork shoulders and beer can chickens
customer_reviews.author: justmeboss

customer_reviews.title: Better than tongs for grilling.
customer_reviews.text: I've used them for barbecue and oven use, they work great. Barbecued skewers one time and tri-tip another. I was able to line up the skewers/tri-tip and turn them with ease without worrying about getting burned and fumbling with tongs. A little bulky so don't expect to be doing anything that requires a great amount of dexterity. Washing a breeze, clean them as if you are washing your hands, hot water, dish soap then hang dry.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Work great for barbecuing!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves literally saved Christmas dinner!! The roast for dinner dripped fat in the grill and flared up the flames. My husband had JUST unwrapped the gloves, grabbed them and used them to remove the flaming, hot roast from the grill. The gloves have great grip on the food, keep away the heat, and are perfect for barbecuing! The flexibility is slightly restrictive, because of the thickness of the material, but I’d rather have it that way to retain the heat retardant abilities!!
customer_reviews.author: MrsH

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have used similar gloves in the past. All have been slick and work well, but having the texture makes all the difference. This makes it easy to take them on and off and get a butter hold of the meat. I will not got back to the old kind again. Buy these over any of the other ones. The only downside is they are a little harder to clean but definitely worth the trade-off
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: This is a great set of gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a while now and let me tell you I have been able to put them through the test. These work great. I use them every time when I have pulled pork on the smoker to make it easy to handle the meat. I have used it shred meat whether it is pork right off the smoker or chicken that is still extremely hot. I find they are easy to clean. I am very satisfied with these.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great heat resistant gloves for the smoker.
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes these. He says they're just a little snug, but he's able to maneuver stuff around on his smoker much easier. They're a little tricky to clean. We kept having the gloves suds back up after rinsing the soap off multiple times. We were just careful to dry them real well after rinsing with REALLY hot water.
customer_reviews.author: Heather M. Schiefer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Used the gloves for the first time to take 20 pound prime rib off of my big green egg grill. Made moving and placing roast on cutting board very easy. Gloves gripped the roast securely and protected my hands from the heat. Will be using them again on Christmas to take a turkey of the grill and carve it. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Brakebill

customer_reviews.title: Next Level BBQ Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: OK, I've had a few pair of gloves in the past, but these are just flat out different! These are by far the best BBQ gloves I have ever owned. My wife found them and ordered me a pair. I promptly ordered a 2nd set, threw my old pair away and now have friends who have ordered them! Highly recommended! I own the original and the newer version. The original pair is a little more flexible, but the new style feel heavier duty. Both are still great!
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: Although the texture of the gloves can make them a little difficult to clean, the structure of the material has made them very effective in handling high temperatures and protecting our hands. We cook very regularly on open flame and in smokers. In one incident, a grill exceeded 700 degrees with a faulty thermostat, and I was able to remove the grill contents without any harm to myself. I would highly recommend these for anyone looking for quality hand protection in grilling and smoking meats.
customer_reviews.author: KateH

customer_reviews.title: Great Versatility!
customer_reviews.text: It’s great to be able to wash the gloves while wearing them! Doing so enables you to handle raw meat with them and wash right after. They are definitely heat resistant as well. Obviously you can’t keep your hand on the grill with them, but it works well to use utensils on the grill without worrying.
customer_reviews.author: B&S

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: Counterfeit item, made in China. Contacted Amazon support and they blamed me for buying it because I know the risks. I am sure the correct item is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Browning

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best gloves ever!
customer_reviews.text: They handle incredible heat, and are great for grilling, and cooking in the house and handling hot pans. I was skeptical about them at first but ended up getting the full length size and they are the best you can get; trust me as I've tried several and they are either very hard to clean because they are cloth or they don't handle the heat. These are the BEST!
customer_reviews.author: v33j

customer_reviews.title: Keeps ya cool and nice grip
customer_reviews.text: These gloves definitely keep your hands and arms from burning. They are a nice length so they cover my arms well. I do a lot of BBQ and smoking. I was able to easily handle all hot items in my smoker and BBQ without concern of being burned. I like that they have a good grip on the hand part and that they are easy to clean after use. They dry pretty quickly after washing. These are good gloves for use when BBQing or smoking foods.
customer_reviews.author: shelngav

customer_reviews.title: No more burning my hands!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love to smoke pork and beef. The first time we smoked a pork butt I used these to take it off the smoker and to shred the meat. No heat transfer at all, however, I wish the material was thinner as I had a hard time with the bulky fingers tearing the meat apart. Other than that, they are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Julie S

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good...
customer_reviews.text: I really do like these but wish they handled the heat a little better. If you're doing a low smoke you are probably going to be ok... But don't use these when you're scrubbing grill grates over high heat. They will handle it for only 5-10 seconds before your hands will start to really feel the heat!
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Great protective gloves for grilling
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these... 1 for my dad & 1 for a friend. They both grill all the time & have said they love these because it protects their hands & arms from the high heat... they've said these gloves make a huge difference. Only thing is that maybe these gloves should come in different sizes, not one size fits all because the gloves are a teensy bit big even for men.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn C.

customer_reviews.title: These are Killer Artesian Griller Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I like to put on my Khaki coveralls, these Killer-Griller gloves, my full facemask respirator and my cool hat. (I got all this stuff on Amazon.) This scares the daylights out of my neighbors when they see a plume of smoke headed their way as I grill. Okay, so I burn everything except my hands thanks to these Killer-Griller gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Wife likes them, but...
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted pit gloves because she had trouble turning a whole chicken in our new smoker just using spatulas. So she picked out these gloves out of all the ones available. So far, she likes them a lot after using them this weekend to handle a brisket. However, she found them to be a bit bulky and large for her hands, which made handling the meat a bit more tenuous than she would prefer. A suggestion for utmost satisfaction would be to offer size options for these gloves. Other than that, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Matysiak

customer_reviews.title: If you grill or smoke you need these
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for a few weeks now for everything from ribs and chicken to a pork belly on my smoker and they are great. So much better then the leather welding gloves because you can actually wash them. I have used them to remove my heat deflector after being over coals for 4 hours and had no problem with the heat. They are easy to put on and take off which is really important to me. They are a great grilling/smoking glove that I would have no problem recommending to anyone who cooks frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Two right handed gloves, not one each of left and right.
customer_reviews.text: All five stars until you realize you ar sold two right handed gloves. NOT A PAIR with one right and one left. Useless for the left handed person. Already opened and used the right hand before putting in the left hand or I would have returned them. Annoying quality control issue. Need would have thought I would have to check for each hand in a set of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have been extremely pleased with these gloves. They work great pulling meat off the pit. They fit well. Extremely easy to clean. I recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Dena Nigh

customer_reviews.title: Great for butts, brisket & ribe
customer_reviews.text: These work great for handling smoked meat. Safer than using “claws” and easier to remove ribs from a rib rack. Cleanup is as simple as washing your hands. I don’t worry about dropping meat when using these and the dexterity while still being insulated makes the gloves a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CES

customer_reviews.title: Loved them so much bought a 2nd pair
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for Thanksgiving when he takes the turkey out of the fryer. Since then, he uses for the grill and also our outside firepit. 1st pair has held up great but he wanted an extra pair since he likes them so much. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rambo

customer_reviews.title: COUNTERFEIT- Made In China
customer_reviews.text: These are counterfeit. They are not from Artisan Griller and they’re made in China. Head to the Artisan Griller website for the authentic product.
customer_reviews.author: Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, nice gloves. Be aware of larger size fit if you have tiny hands!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what they say they are! Big hands will fit in these easily and they'll still slip off without binding. This pair WAS 14" from center fingertip to top of wrist gauntlet (at least one reviewer said theirs was not) and they seem well made. Comfy inner lining. Small handed people will want to wear tight gardening gloves or something similar inside these as they are large for ease of slipping on and off. Very happy with this purchase and the proactive customer support email making sure everything was okay with the item.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Tiura

customer_reviews.title: Buy these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pair, and gifted one. This is a great product, I like the dexterity afforded to you over Silicone version. The cuff covers your forearm to just short of the elbow joint allowing you to reach across the grill or into the smoker without fear of a burn. We grilled some really thick ribeyes and I turned my steaks with the gloves no more stabing the meat. I used the gloves last week to remove a large salt plate from the oven (400 degrees) I had about 15 sec before I felt the heat through the gloves. Will recomend and gift as long as they are available.
customer_reviews.author: DONALD MARSHALL

customer_reviews.title: I found that a pair of suede work gloves did a better job insulating me against the heat
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are okay. I can see how they could work if you're shuffling items around on a home BBQ. In the camping environment, these gloves were only okay. My plan was to use these gloves for popping Jiffy-Pop popcorn on top of a camping fire pit grate. Unfortunately, these gloves didn't insulate well enough against the heat. I found that a pair of suede work gloves did a better job insulating me against the heat.
customer_reviews.author: osakajoe

customer_reviews.title: TWO LEFT HANDED GLOVES RECEIVED
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the gloves in advance of a huge cookout for Independence Day. Received on time, HOWEVER, when I opened the package...I DISCOVERED TWO LEFT HANDED GLOVES. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT!!!
customer_reviews.author: M Pallo

customer_reviews.title: Didn't protect from hands from grill heat
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why our experience is so different, but these gloves did NOT protect our hands from the heat of a grill. They are ok for handling chicken or other food after it has come off the grill, but unless you are doing something very low temperature, I wouldn't recommend these for general grill use.
customer_reviews.author: cvillian

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time finding gloves that fit so I am skeptical ordering gloves online. I used the sites guidelines for sizing and when I received the gloves they fit great! Good quality, as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: gestnerd

customer_reviews.title: Decent gloves but they don't keep you from getting burned like you'd think
customer_reviews.text: These do work but your hands will kinda burn from doing things like pulling pork apart. Haven't tried others to see if that's normal but I would assume I could handle hunks of meat right off the smoker without playing hot potato
customer_reviews.author: Mista Kut

customer_reviews.title: Quality gloves, great fit and use ability
customer_reviews.text: Easy on and off. Great length up the arm. Generally better then other options in the heat resistance factor. Hands do get toasty after prolonged (30secs or so) of holding fresh off the grill/oven metal trays. Easy clean. Durable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for handling hot food
customer_reviews.text: First pair of cooking gloves, they work great, I am able to handle hot meats and while you feel the warmth, it helps in handling stuff close to the charcoal ... it is definitely better than using regular gloves.. we shall see how much they last
customer_reviews.author: JoSe

customer_reviews.title: Can't take the heat
customer_reviews.text: These can only take heat to 400 degrees - they're meant more for smokers than grills it seems. Other brands can handle much more heat. I set these aside and ordered another pair that can take the heat. Also, the 13" is short to reach the back of a grill and leaves your forearms exposed. I would recommend 17".
customer_reviews.author: RiodeJaneiro

customer_reviews.title: Good, not Great
customer_reviews.text: I like the length and overall usefulness of the gloves. They don't do well for dexterity or extended periods of heat. It doesn't take long for them to become uncomfortable when working with hot pork shoulder or turning multiple pieces of meat on a hot grill. They retain the heat for a while as well. Maybe an insert would help...
customer_reviews.author: Will Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Father's Day gift
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my boyfriend for Father's Day, and he loves it. The gloves are sturdy and protect his hands when he is grilling, but they also have room for movement so it isn't so stiff. Great price for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Allison LaCombe

customer_reviews.title: They will protect your hands and arms from the heat.
customer_reviews.text: I tested these gloves while barbecuing 3 racks of ribs over hardwood charcoal. Even while manipulating the meat and basting it with sauce, my hands didn't feel the heat. I didn't even singe the hair on my arms! I have large hands, and these are very large. If you have small hands they may not work for you. They are also very stiff - but I didn't find that to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Flore

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker and grill gloves
customer_reviews.text: After burning my hands numerous times or dropping perfectly smoked ribs, I finally bought these gloves to protect my hands. They are perfect. No more burning fingers. Dexterity is really good in fingers and palms making moving meat around very easy. I can pick up hot grates and relocate without my fingers even getting warm. Cleaning them is easy as washing your hands. Would recommend to anyone using a smoker or grill.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline J.

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a gift for my son and husband. They both love the gloves, when smoking meat they can pick it up, not worry about the heat or the juices absorbing into the gloves. He has ruined many pot holders and gloves when BBQ-ing. These are terrific, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NanaS

customer_reviews.title: They can't take the heat
customer_reviews.text: These gloves allowed for a better grip than I thought. Took pork shoulder from smoker to tons low cooker with no problem. Later when I removed the pork from the slow cooker to pull it apart, I felt like there was no heat shielding at all. I shouldn't be burning my fingers touching meat with an internal temp of about 180 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: JOEL LAZARUS

customer_reviews.title: Work ok size runs very small
customer_reviews.text: Purchased extra large and paid a premium price because supposedly made in America.. They are very tight for xl.. Can't hardly get them on or off
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Gloves only good for a few seconds before starting to fail
customer_reviews.text: These gloves did not live up to my expectations or the other reviews. I had to remove a hot tray from the oven and noticed some items blocking my spot so I needed to hold tray for and extra 20 seconds. My fingers started to burn. Things got very hot. Gloves only good for a few seconds before starting to fail. Would not recommend and would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jerry E. Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Just great.
customer_reviews.text: After almost two years with them I have to say these are wonderful, from handling hot and moist foods to very hot surfaces these gloves have exceeded my expectations. In short one of the best purchases I’ve made for my grilling (after a Carlson Rodizio)
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Must have for bbq grill masters
customer_reviews.text: Good bbq gloves. Handle messy foods with confidence. Don't expect to be picking up small objects with them but I am able to flip burgers with one hand so decent use of your fingers. Warning: these are for lower heat applications. Great for my ribs and other items run under 250 degrees. Anything around or above the 250 mark you feel the heat through them quickly. Set your expectations correctly; great for handling foods, you need a different pair of gloves if you are needing to handle any hot metals like your grill grate or pots pans ect
customer_reviews.author: Brittney GAYLE

customer_reviews.title: clumsy and not very heat protectvie
customer_reviews.text: Online info mentions protection against hot water and steam because the package insert says glove can only briefly be used for temperatures above the low 200s. Also I find them to be very clumsy. I'll keep them to put unlit barbecue coals on the grill so my hands will stay clean, but that's it.
customer_reviews.author: shopper86

customer_reviews.title: Good for low smokes
customer_reviews.text: BIG MISTAKE buying these! Gloves are rated for ONLY "225-275 degrees" and INTERMITTENT heat of "up to 400 degrees F". Good for low smokes. But that is all! Wasted money and I opened just after window of return expired. If all you do is smoke, these will handle low temp smokes. Anything the least bit higher temp of cooking or grilling, FORGET IT, unsafe and they perhaps will melt, besides burn you!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis R

customer_reviews.title: They do it all
customer_reviews.text: For bbq gloves to be useful they must not only be heat resistant but also flexible enough to pick up things. Must also be easy on and off. I had several other gloves which were so slippery nothing could be grasped and some that were almost impossible to get off. These gloves meet my expectations and needs in all categories. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use around my outdoor grill, they DO NOT afford heat protection...they will burn your hands just from radiant heat. Going back to oven mitts, which are VERY heat resistant !
customer_reviews.author: Megaboat

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for use with the smaller deep fryers, fit is good...wouldn't use these for the turkey fryer as it doesn't give you are protection. They would work if you are wearing long sleeves, but I bought a long pair as well.
customer_reviews.author: Julie S.

customer_reviews.title: These are the real deal!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Go a good ways up the arm so you don't bump your arm and get burned. No heat gets through. I reach into the smoker and grab racks of ribs that are dripping and nothing gets through.
customer_reviews.author: Kristeen Ryan-Long

customer_reviews.title: Father’s Day Gift done right!
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift for my husband for his Pellet smoking business. He absolutely loved them and couldn’t believe how well they are made. I did a lot of research and there were the best out there.
customer_reviews.author: Vonnie

customer_reviews.title: So i have been missing something for the last 27-years i have been grillin....
customer_reviews.text: Where have these gloves been all my life!!! I was watching an episode of Pitmasters, and someone used gloves like these to pull apart their pork without burning their hands. I've tried the claw things and they are a step up from using two forks. However these gloves are the Cadillac of the BBQ accessories. You can just grab the meat right off the grill. Freedom from tongs, claws, oven mitts, etc. I Love my Gloves!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Vinson

customer_reviews.title: It was good for about a month then the insulation gave out ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during the holidays last year. It was good for about a month then the insulation gave out and became extremely hot and burned my hands. I wish i did not
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves made in the USA!!
customer_reviews.text: Made in the USA! Love these gloves; they work great to handle hot foods on the grill and are easy to clean! Great dexterity as well and would buy again. Love buying well made American products.
customer_reviews.author: Drift

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Long!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these. This is my third pair. I need them everywhere. My only complaint is that they only come in size XL. I have very small hands (size 5 ring size), do these are enormous on me. How about making more than one size?
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Poodle Mom

customer_reviews.title: Durable and heat resistant
customer_reviews.text: Used for deep frying and smoking foods. Long enough to protect your arms and able to grab the lid and thermometer in the turkey deep fryer. Grip also allowed us to transfer the hot Turkey to the cutting board
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Elj

customer_reviews.title: Like the length of these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Like the length of these gloves. Bought to use with my outdoor BBQs and they have worked just fine. I use some cast iron grills and pots and heat them to 350+ before cooking and I can use the gloves to lift them around the BBQ area. Instruction say will "comfortably handle BBQ temps of 225-275 degrees F with intermittent heat to 400 degrees F." I have had no trouble moving my pots and griddles around the cooking surface. Especially like the fact they are long and cover my lower arm which sometimes comes in contact with the pot. Great price and great customer service from the company.
customer_reviews.author: RCM

customer_reviews.title: Terrible smell
customer_reviews.text: These leave gross black residue with a strong chemical smell all over your hands
customer_reviews.author: k.bar

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep heat out as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: They don't keep the heat out as other gloves. When I wear theme and reach into the grill to grad and flip whatever it is I'm cooking, they work for about three seconds, then get hot and stay hot. I thought maybe that's just how they were, but recently tried my buddy's gloves and they work so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Efren Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Protect your hands
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. I used them with my grill tonight and decided to really put them to the test. I actually picked up the grill grate while the grill was registering about 350 ̊F and moved it so I could spread wood chips over the charcoal. I didn't even feel heat through the gloves. Later, I decided to try the ultimate test and while the coals were glowing, I picked up the bottom grate. Still no heat felt through the gloves. I thought for sure I would have melted the exterior of the gloves but no melting, no damage done. The gloves are terrific, very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: The Baroque Girl

customer_reviews.title: ... oil-less deep fryer I had another pair of gloves like these for my rotisserie chicken these are a little ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these clubs from my oil-less deep fryer I had another pair of gloves like these for my rotisserie chicken these are a little less insulated I can feel the temperature through the gloves a little bit but they are efficient enough to take the basket out of the out of The Big Easy I was worried about getting burnt when I take the basket out these do the job but you can feel a walk through not like you're going to get burnt but I'd let you know that the baskets hot I would recommend looking into something a little bit thicker Maybe but these will do the job for the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smoker Gloves you need these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wanted to pick up meat off my smoker to carry into the house or transfer to a pan. I had a fabric pair that got janky lifting yummy meat, so I got these. They're water proof, heavy duty, and still tactile. I just rinse them when I'm done. They're great.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Christopher Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great heat protection
customer_reviews.text: I started off with someone's advice to get welding gloves, but quickly discovered they'll get all kinds of dirty since the fabric will soak up grease and grime. I bought these because they looked easy to keep clean plus the heat protection. They work great. I use them with a Big Green Egg. They are very handy and much less awkward than trying to use tools. I've turned meat, taken out the plate setter, moved hot racks and pans, and checked temps over 500° cooks. As another commenter wrote, cleaning is just a matter of washing hands in dish soap.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Burger

customer_reviews.title: The Best Insulted Gloves for Working With Wet Hot Foods
customer_reviews.text: My buddy uses these when cooking on his pit barbecue in Texas, as do most of the other pit masters I seen. These industrial looking gloves allow you to use your hands on wet foods that would soak into cloth gloves or towels and that spells burns as the heat bridges the insulative properties of the cloth and gets to your skin. I am able to pick up, turn over, and shred a 8 pound pork shoulder shortly after taking it off the grill with these gloves. The long cuffs can be folded down easily, or left long when reaching into the barbecue oven. I love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Paniolo Pete

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for grilling and smoking
customer_reviews.text: My husband got these to use with his Traeger. He loves them! Is able to reach back into the smoker and turn the meat very easily witho it fear of getting burnt. They come up nice and high on the forearm to decrease risk of being burnt by the upper rack. Very easy to wash as well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Gifted these for my dad last year, he loves them. Great to use with BBQ and or smoker. He says they are great. Just got another pair for a friend with a new smoker.
customer_reviews.author: RED

customer_reviews.title: One Size Does Not Fit All
customer_reviews.text: They are really nice gloves except they are too large for me, and even larger for my wife. The tips of our fingers don't reach to the end. If you have short fingers, this will be too big. It would be nice if they can come out with a small size, or the usual small, medium, large.
customer_reviews.author: mario u.

customer_reviews.title: ... they made a medium but they are still the best i have tried for working with my smoker
customer_reviews.text: would give these five stars if they made a medium but they are still the best i have tried for working with my smoker. i have a cabinet full of silicone mitts, silicone gloves, ov gloves, and what have you, for barbecue and smoking these are the best. update: after using these with my smoker I had a chance for other uses. I have allways had a tough time moving pre-heated bowls for my giant popovers around in the over, these gloves worked like a charm. I am a believer.
customer_reviews.author: KenNQC

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are the best. I am a big guy and these gloves ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are the best. I am a big guy and these gloves fit perfectly - plenty of room for XXL hands and pliable enough to work with your grill and food you are planning to grill and/or smoke. The glove have a soft liner inside is that adds a little comfort factor while you work...heat protection is great as well. So far, have not had any trouble working with my grill at about 450-475...they protect me as advertised. Highly recommend grabbing a pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Good protection and flexible enough to allow normal handling
customer_reviews.text: These gloves provide a very reasonable buffer between your fingers and the hot source you may need to manipulate. You will be able to touch and even hold a (very) hot source, for several seconds: It is more than enough to open a smoker coal door, throw in some new wood chips, or even take something out of a conventional oven. These gloves will manage to protect you from burning your fingers WHILE being elastic enough for almost normal hand operation. They are also very easily washable. I do recommend these gloves !
customer_reviews.author: Uruguayan Traveller

customer_reviews.title: These are great gloves that stop the hot oils from burning your ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves that stop the hot oils from burning your hands while turning or moving meats while cooking. They have a easy on and off fabric liner so you don't have too fight the gloves putting them on or pulling them off. Long enough to protect your arms from the heat. Thanks and Regards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Artisan Griller Redefining Outdoor Cooking BBQ Heat Resistant Insulated Smoker, Grill, Fryer, Oven, Cooking Gloves. Barbecue/Frying/Grilling – Waterproof, Oil Resistant -1 pair (Size 10/XL - Fits Most
feature_bullets: ✔PRO DESIGN - Best design for Barbecue Pits and Pitmasters With An Insulated Non-Slip Five Finger Design So You Can Manage Hot Meats In your Smoker, Rotisserie or BBQ and make pulled pork Like The Pros! The 13" length adds extended protection for most of your arm. Just as useful in the kitchen as they are grilling or frying. The black Large size 10 set of gloves fits most people and is easy to put on and take off

✔COMFORTABLE & FLAME RESISTANT - The Pit Glove has a soft jersey cotton liner that fits loosely so your hands stays cool and comfortable while smoking meats, pulling pork , baking, pickling and other household tasks. The food grade neoprene coating is EN 407 compliant and resistant to melting and is fire resistant, protecting your hands around smokers, grill flames and fire, making them a great camping accessory.

✔PREMIUM NEOPRENE COATING - The FDA compliant neoprene rubber coating is waterproof and offers great flexibility while offering max protection from boiling water and steam - over knitted gloves. The waterproof neoprene coating on this glove is resistant to heat, grease, oil, water and stains. They are much more flexible than silicone and just as easy to clean - just wash on your hands and hang to dry
✔MAKES A GREAT GIFT - You'll love this glove so much that you'll have to hide it from your friends - so do both of you a favor and buy several for a gift. ✪✪
